I know that Evelynn has a (nerfed) mana regen on her passive, but giving mana to a skill that doesn't need it makes Riot look like a bunch of idiots trying to pull this off while Riven and co. got reverts. I actually thought the Riven passive was cool and very balanced for someone with no mana. Evelynn is no prime pick, and from what I've seen and when I play as her, she is not easy at all.
Her Q, which has been nerfed to, deal(s) 40/50/60/70/80 (+35/40/45/50/55% AP) (+50/55/60/65/70% **bonus** AD) for 12/18/24/30/36 mana per use (so this is the one thing I could see and would not care as much if it went up to 12/20/28/36/42 mana per use).
Her E is one thing I honestly wouldn't ever care if the mana went up to maybe 70/75/80/85/90 mana per use because it is strong. 
Putting 40 extra mana cost in her kit is just horrible and its not even balance.

It's not all Rioter's lying and being condescending. There are quite a few Rioter's who if I had the chance to meet, I would very much respect them based on reputation alone. Yet, we only hear a few voices from the Balance Team, and among those it is Meddler the most.

While generally I think Meddler does have to make tough decisions on who to nerf and buff/rework, the consistent Eve nerfs are too much. While Runeglaive has given Eve some life back into her, her core strength revolved around her stealth. I can guarantee you, in the average normal game people will individually ignore wards, with regular exceptions being the support and jungler. This give's Evelynn so much power especially if nobody buys any Vision wards.

> [{quoted}](name=Uiraya,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BqM5huWl,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2015-10-02T23:26:10.581+0000)
>
> Power budget is a fine concept until you find out that mobility doesn't cost anything and permastealth costs EVERYTHING.

That's because while mobility is powerful, permanent stealth is *the single most powerful mechanic in the game* in the hands of a competent player.
Evelyn's stealth isn't real stealth though, it just lets her get close to gank. It's not like "bye I'm repositioning and you can't target me" like every other stealth in the game.

Evelynn's stealth is more like you can't see her unless you see her.

Like, really, the only good thing about it is some surprising positioning and bypassing normal wards. In which case, yeah, those are pretty damn important things, but why does her stealth so non-stealthy compared to others? If they hate it so badly in her kit, what's wrong with removing it?

> [{quoted}](name=Uiraya,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BqM5huWl,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2015-10-02T23:26:10.581+0000)
>
> Power budget is a fine concept until you find out that mobility doesn't cost anything and permastealth costs EVERYTHING.

Stealth is the strongest thing in the entire game. It's the sole reason why Rengar is insanely punishing if he gets even slightly ahead, and it's the sole reason why old Evenlynn was nerfed from orbit.

Difference between Rengo and Eve:  Rengo can stealth and walk through your team to his target.  Eve can sneak through words (like Rengo) but has to get around teams without being seen to reach her target, as she loses stealth if she even gets close to them.  Also, Rengo can literally 100-0 someone in .5 seconds when ahead by not that much gold against enemy squishies.  Eve can burst them down too, but not to that extent and she usually gets killed or severely injured getting the kill by the enemy team unless she can get a 1v1.  Rengo has the problem of enemy teams as well, but he can usually do fine in a 1v1 after bursting down an enemy, giving him effective 2v1 or even 3v1 potential.  Eve can only do such things if the enemies ignore her or are out of position and she can get a series of mini 1v1's off.  Her ult helps to live long enough to burst someone and deal some AOE in groups though, so she has a lot of potential in teamfights, but she's nowhere near as snowbally as Rengo, and she pays a lot more for her stealth than he does, having no sustain or gap closers and relying on her speedup to chase down enemies instead of straight ambushing them.  She does have the higher DPS if she can stay on them though, so it's really a matter of what situation she's in.
